1596079219_1LVZEMhitcYT5Q7bw5Hy9qWURWK5U.body: Clarification: one of the main reason for why ZeroNet isn't "safe" when not using the tor browser is that clear-net references from ZeroNet will be traceable. This is easily fixed by telling your browser to use tor (127.0.0.1:9050) as a proxy and exclude 127.0.0.1 from being proxied. There are of course other reasons to user the Tor-browser like being a gray man, i.e. having the same fingerprint as everyone else.

1597871943_1CrFEcv59gAFWe7w5wbKxCYJg3sDg.body:
> [grouch0](#comment_1_1CrFEcv59gAFWe7w5wbKxCYJg3sDg48tUt): For anyone else looking for the answer in the TOR address bar type 'about:config' then search for 'network.proxy.no_proxies_on' then enter 127.0.0.1 as the value.

It depends on what program you are using though. For some programs the environment variables NO_PROXY and no_proxy can also be used. Programs like curl and wget respect these variables.
